We're looking for a strong senior-level Support Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

h1
overview
text
Overview
p
project-details
Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.
The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The back-end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!
whats-in-it-for-you
What’s in it for you
ol
li
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
required-qualifications
Required Qualifications
5+ years of full-time hands-on coding experience.
3+ years of full-time hands-on experience with Python, Django (or similar like Flask / FastAPI / Pyramid / Tornado).
2+ years of SQL experience.
Intermediate knowledge of raw SQL including but not limited to indexing, using different types of joins and group by.
Able to have a conversation about technical details speaking and writing English in real-time.
Ability to write clean, modular, scalable, well-tested code, setting an example for others.
Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, and create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting proactively.
Strong knowledge of scalable backend API performance and tools.
Experience with unit testing.
A clear understanding of the runtime complexity of the code being written.
Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long-term with a high degree of care.
nice-to-haves
Nice to haves
A formal Computer Science degree.
Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated
br
testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Deep understanding of runtime complexity and memory complexity using
Big O notation.
Growth stage startup experience.
Technical leadership experience.
h2
frequently-asked-questions
Frequently Asked Questions
blockquote
em
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client size team is 20 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

/opportunities/senior-seo-manager-220
Senior SEO Manager
Senior SEO
Manager
monitor-dashboard

We're looking for a Senior SEO Manager. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance provides top-tier technology talent for innovative companies in the US. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

We're a USA-based company producing video solutions with the mission to advance scientific research and education. Our institutional clients comprise over 1,000 universities, colleges, and biopharma companies, including such leaders as Harvard, MIT, Yale, and Stanford. As a rapidly growing company, with offices in the USA, UK, Australia, and India servicing clients in over 60 countries, we are seeking talented individuals to join our company.
You'll have a tremendous impact on the bottom line of the business. A lot of our traffic is organic, and our SEO needs to be spot-on. You'll oversee all aspects of SEO for all of our products and domains. As the Sr. SEO Manager, you'll work across all teams to develop and implement strategies to improve online visibility, rankings, conversions, and ROI by optimizing our content and website structure. We're an established company and have been in the market for 17+ years. Now, we need you to take it to the next level.
What you'll do:
Develop a holistic SEO strategy that grows organic search traffic and conversions and aligns with the overall company goals and priorities; execute the roadmap; and track performance.

Proactively test, analyze, and make changes to product domains to ensure they are optimized for search engines and rank higher in the search results on major search engines (e.g., Google, Google Scholar, Bing).
Conduct regular website audits to identify areas for improvement and implement necessary changes.

Contribute SEO expertise to the overall website strategy and collaborate with other departments within the company, such as Marketing, Sales, Business Development, Technology, and Product, to ensure content and overall Information Architecture drive relevant traffic by meeting search intent.
Collaborate with the Engineering team to implement SEO-friendly technical changes (e.g., optimize for Web Vitals, add appropriate schema).
Define, tune, execute, and capitalize on content gaps with our competitors, content growth, and content optimization opportunities.
Keep ahead of the newest SEO strategies, techniques, and best practices to improve our SEO strategies continuously.
Discover link opportunities through competitive backlink research via tools such as Majestic SEO, Ahrefs, Open Site Explorer, and SEM Rush.
Monitor and report key performance indicators such as indexing, rankings, backlinks, and SERP click-through rates.
8+ years of full-time hands-on SEO experience.
3+ years of full-time hands-on SEO Manager/Lead experience.
High level of attention to detail and extreme focus on quality of results (essential).
Strong SEO knowledge and the ability to translate complex topics for a non-technical audience.
Experience analyzing data, finding insights, and presenting findings to internal and/or external stakeholders, including at the executive level.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to drive meaningful actions from large data sets.
Experience with SEO and website analytics tools (e.g. Google Analytics, SEMRush, Ahrefs, Google Search Console, Lighthouse, Pagespeed Insight, etc.).
Demonstrated ability to keep current with trends and technological advancements in SEO, UI/UX, Google algorithm updates, etc.
Ability to manage time and organize projects; works well under pressure and can meet strict deadlines.
Experience interacting with customers, senior executives, and business leaders.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and follow through to ensure timely completion.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to consult on projects and present information effectively.
Knowledge of conversion optimization principles and techniques.
Experience with Ed-Tech, Journal, and Research market-specific search engines such as Google Scholar, Google Books, Web of Science, Scopus, Paperpile, etc.
Previous experience with SEM and social media marketing is a plus.

The Right Balance team is 60+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client size team is 548+ people. The timing is great to be a part of a rapidly growing team making meaningful contributions.
